greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of ways to write n = x + y with 0 < x <= y such that x!*y + 1 is prime.
comment: Conjecture: a(n) > 0 for all n > 1. Also, any integer n > 3 can be written as x + y with 0 < x <= y such that x!*y -1 is prime.
We have verified the conjecture for n up to 10^6.
link: Zhi-Wei Sun, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..2000
results.author: _Zhi-Wei Sun_, Nov 11 2013
